Get help with trading strategies and market data queries

output_examples.input: How do I fetch the order book for a specific Polymarket market?
output: Use the CLOB API endpoint: GET /book?asset_id={token_id}
Required: Asset ID (token ID) for the market outcome
Response includes: bids array, asks array, timestamp, hash
Example response shows price levels and available sizes at each level

best_practices: Implement proper rate limiting to avoid API throttling
Use WebSocket connections for real-time data instead of polling
Store API credentials securely and never expose them in client-side code
Validate all order parameters before submission to prevent errors
anti_patterns: Don't hardcode API keys or private keys in source code
Avoid excessive polling - use WebSocket subscriptions for real-time data
Don't ignore rate limit responses - implement exponential backoff

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Polymarket provides official clients in Python (py-clob-client) and TypeScript (@polymarket/clob-client).

faq.question: What are the rate limits for the API?
faq.answer: General CLOB endpoints: 5000 requests/10s. Trading endpoints have burst allowances up to 2400/10s for order operations.

faq.question: How does authentication work?
faq.answer: Two levels: L1 (private key signing for orders) and L2 (API key for requests). WebSocket user channel requires authentication.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation. Your credentials are never stored. Always use environment variables for sensitive keys.

faq.question: Why are my orders failing?
faq.answer: Common causes: insufficient balance/allowance, invalid signature, wrong negRisk flag, expired orders, or tick size precision errors.

faq.question: How is Polymarket different from other exchanges?
faq.answer: Polymarket is peer-to-peer with no trading fees. Uses non-custodial wallets on Polygon with USDC collateral.
